title: üìù What did we learn in Module 1?
lead: Congratulations on completing the first module! See below the main questions we explored and their answers.

a1.title: ‚ùì What does the customer expect when contacting us?
a1.text: The customer expects more than just the solution to the problem. They seek:
a1.l1: To be heard with attention and empathy
a1.l2: To receive quick and efficient service
a1.l3: To feel that the company cares about them
a1.l4: To have clarity about next steps
a1.l5: To leave satisfied, even when the answer is not ideal

a2.title: ‚ùì What is the role of CS beyond solving problems?
a2.text: Customer Service represents the company's voice in direct contact with the customer. More than an operational sector, it is a strategic area essential to:

a3.title: ‚ùì What are our team's responsibilities?
a3.l1: Multichannel Service: phone, email, chat and electronic means
a3.l2: Inbound Service: information, complaints, suggestions and compliments
a3.l3: Outbound Service: campaigns, card activation, registration updates
a3.l4: Management: organize data, prepare reports, propose improvements

a4.title: ‚ùì Why do response deadlines matter?
a4.text: Well-defined deadlines ensure organization, predictability and efficiency. The correct registration of the service category is fundamental because the system calculates the deadline based on it.
a4.prazos_padrao: Standard Deadlines: Requests: up to 3 business days | Information: up to 2 business days | Complaints: up to 2 business days
a4.prazos_especiais: Special Deadlines: Damages: up to 5 business days | Duplicate payment: up to 8 business days

conclusion.title: Module 1 Conclusion
conclusion.text: Now you understand why Customer Service is strategic for the company. In the next module, we'll discover where to find information that the customer needs!
